io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.controller

Interface PortfolioDAO

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibernatePortfolioDAO, SQLPortfolioDAO

    public interface PortfolioDAO
extends java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    Interface that defines a data access object for accessing the datasource of a stock portfolio. Implementations of this interface should be used to save/load a stock portfolio between program sessions. This allows for an abstraction layer to exist between the program's implementation and the logic used to access the data storage location.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig

      Returns a portfolio loaded from the data source that matches the specified file name.

      Returns a list of the file names all saved portfolios from the data source.

      Removes an external PropertyChangeListener so that events are no longer passed to it as the model is being constructed.
      void savePortfolio(PortfolioModel portfolio)
      Saves the portfolio to the data source for storing its values between program sessions.

      • createNewPortfolio

        PortfolioModel createNewPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                                  java.math.BigDecimal startingCashBalance)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new stock portfolio, with the specified name and starting cash balance.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio.
        startingCashBalance - the starting cash balance of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        a new stock portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs while trying to access the data source.

      • getSavedPortfolios

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSavedPortfolios()
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a list of the file names all saved portfolios from the data source.
        Returns:
        a list of the names of all saved portfolios.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs while trying to access the data source.

      • getPortfolio

        PortfolioModel getPortfolio(java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a portfolio loaded from the data source that matches the specified file name. NOTE: if the file name string does not match the expected file name format, an exception will be thrown. To avoid this, this method should maintain an explicit contract with getSavedPortfolios(). The file name parameter here should be a perfect match to the format of the strings in the list returned by that method.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the portfolio loaded from the data source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs while trying to access the data source, or if the file name parameter isn't a valid file name for a portfolio.
        See Also:
        PortfolioDAO.getSavedPortfolios()

      • savePortfolio

        void savePortfolio(PortfolioModel portfolio)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves the portfolio to the data source for storing its values between program sessions.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - the portfolio to be saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs while trying to access the data source.
